description:
Job Title: HR Generalist

Location: Playa Vista (onsite)

Position Summary:

A dynamic community center dedicated to facilitating pet adoptions, hosting community events, and offering learning opportunities that highlight the bond between people and pets. We are seeking an experienced HR Generalist to join our team, reporting to the Sr. HR Manager. The ideal candidate will support various HR functions, manage the volunteer program, and ensure compliance with HR policies.

Key Responsibilities:

Human Resources:

  • Talent Acquisition & Onboarding: Support the HR department in sourcing, recruiting, training, and onboarding new employees and volunteers.
  • Payroll Management: Ensure accurate entry of payroll information into Paylocity, manage bi-weekly payroll processes, and verify payroll deductions/withholdings. Ensure compliance with federal and state payroll, wage, and hour requirements.
  • Benefits Administration: Assist with the management of benefits plans (medical, dental, vision, FSA, and retirement plans), including 403(b) enrollments, communications, and mandatory reporting.
  • Employee Relations: Handle employee relations issues, maintain accurate records, and ensure the Employee Handbook is updated and compliant annually.
  • Meetings & Interviews: Schedule and coordinate meetings and interviews for open positions.
  • Record-Keeping: Maintain accurate records and ensure all HR documentation is compliant with relevant laws and regulations.
  • HR Financials: Reconcile HR credit card transactions and manage expense reports.

Volunteer Program:

  • Program Development: Create and implement a comprehensive volunteer program, including developing program structure, policies, and a volunteer handbook.
  • Recruitment & Scheduling: Recruit, train, and schedule volunteers, ensuring all volunteer records and schedules are accurately maintained.
  • Retention & Recognition: Focus on volunteer retention and recognition, implementing strategies to appreciate and engage volunteers.
  • Orientation: Conduct orientation sessions for new volunteers to integrate them effectively into the organization.

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in human resources, payroll management, and benefits administration.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Experience with HRIS systems, preferably Paylocity.
  • Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
  • Experience in volunteer management is a plus.
